reviews.review_msg: THE WORST Prof EVER! Never notify schedule in advance with all the old information and the info is HARD to find on the webpage. Basically you will never know what to do till the last moment.

Has conflicting information within the lecture notes and discussion areas, both for the content and administrative details. Assignments were released weeks late while deadlines were extended by a few days at best. Only grades released before final were the automatically graded quizzes and first assignment which was due in the third week of class.

This course has been the most disorganized course I have ever taken. Assignments and quizzes were never released on time, and throughout the entire semester, there was no grading or feedback provided for any assignments. The final assignment was even updated three times before the final version was confirmed.

1. Irresponsible.
2. Highly protracted. (late in posting Assignments, releasing final info, grades, practice materials, etc).
3. Hard to comment on the Quality of Assignments...
Regardless of personal knowledges, not a helpful prof at all.

Professor reads off of slides written by Mo Chen 
No assignment mark came out before the 40% final exam! That means from the very first assignment to the very last one, no grades or solutions or feedbacks were released to the students
This is a good course someone should take if they want to kill their interest in machine learning.
First time seeing prof releasing homework super late with live patches because not all questions were ready. Read off the slides in lectures. Overall, it is just super disorganized.
I can read slides as well.
He is such a brilliant professor who encouraged everyone to build up strong self-study abilities. I think he should receive an early retirement as a reward

This is one of the best courses I have taken in my entire educational life. Thank you Greg from the bottom of my heart for instructing an amazingly great ML class. If I could, I would have taken this course 10 times more. Greg is the best prof I have ever seen in my entire life. Very difficult course, at least for me. Requires 100%dedication.
He is great! He knows what he is talking about and keeps you busy with the right materials.
He is the best prof you could have ever
Greg's lectures are great, although the assignments are really tough.
The best prof I've ever had. Although I won't get a good grade, but Greg is the best.

Seriously, are you being paid to prepare one unique package for the courses you offer?? Don't you think your secret package is not secrety the second time you're gonna use it. If you don't know what I mean, it's about your homeworkS  and exam.

He has one set of homework questions, and uses it every time he offers the course. Moreover it is incredible painful when the level of contributions among students for doing homework and project, is not taken serous by professor.
USES SAME SET OF HOMEWORK QUESTIONS. SO IT'D BE SUCH AN EASY COURSE IF YOU HAVE A FRIEND WHO ALREADY TOOK THIS COURSE AND HAVE THE ANSWERS THAT PROF SENT OUT.

The course is ideal for students who aim to squander time, lack motivation, and end up disappointed.

The instructor's approach to teaching was extremely insufficient. The presentation slides in the lectures lacked proper annotations and details (no explanation!), which made it difficult for students to follow along with the concepts being taught.

1. He just read from the slides without providing enough context or detail. You'll constantly hear words like "You know" and similar ones.
2. The slides presented are poor in quality. Equations and concepts are not explained clearly.
3. Errors happened in different areas during the course, including all quizzes, assignments, grades, and solutions.

It was a tough subject, made even tougher by Ke Li. He thinks everyone in the class is a math genius and teaches high-level math in the course.Tough assignments and quizzes. Will make you do unnecessary stuff like writing assignments in Latex.
Avoid this class.
Awful professor. He made the final exam so challenging and didn't bother to scale up the course...
The lectures are not helpful. He reads off from the slides, without explaining why or how. Avoid this class.
Mo's homework often requires readings and material not explicitly taught in class. This is further exacerbated by the lack of a requirement of STAT 270 and MATH 251.
Avoid him, he can't teach machine learning at all.. the lectures are waste of time
The course itself may not be that interesting (lots of math) but Professor Chen explains everything well and clearly. Also, he is patient during the office hour.

He explained mathematic in a very clear way and this course is really useful if you'd like to take the other 700-level courses, e.g. NLP, CG. 
However, this course is heavy of maths and includes lots of quizzes. If you are not confident in math skill, I would suggest to audit instead of enrolment.
Good luck for those also interested in ML. :)
Awful

He shows pre-recorded lectures in which he dispassionately reads math off slides.
Does not explain tough concepts properly.
Will never take it again.

I suspect that the quizzes are made by TAs. The questions are unclear and usually have mistakes, which are sources of disputes and arguments. Hope that professor can spend more time to improve the quizzes and logistics of the course, so that students won't feel confused with no timely clarifications. The course is easy if you are good at math.

This has got to be the worst course I have ever taken in my university career. I would estimate that the professor spent less than 2 hours per week of effort. All assignments, quizzes, and even the final exam were made by the TAs, Mo did nothing - that's how lazy he is. All were littered with typos, errors, and unclear questions.  Absolutely awful.

Kind, decent lecturer; toxic course environment. Professor/course staff largely inaccessible with inconsistent/confusing office hours schedule, and largely ignored Piazza. Unclear homeworks weren't always connected to course material, quizzes were unclear/imprecise and usually had incorrect answer keys, and grades were released late/never.

I don't blame the lack of knowledge on what he teaches but he is dishonest. He DO NOT HAVE CompSci BACKGROUND but always pretends he knows much about it. He wrote on his website that he graduated in computer science from UT but he was actually Cognitive Science majored. In addition, he did his master and Phd in Philosophy Dept at CMU! Not CompSci!

I took his machine learning course. He was using the material from one of the other professors from the department. He did not understand the material himself; therefore the lectures were mostly there to confuse you. I only learned through reading the textbook; watching online courses. To be fair, he tries very hard; he is just not a good teacher!

His assignments were exactly  the assignments that Dr. Greg Mori used for his Machine Learning course twice. So almost everyone had already the  correct solutions. Therefore by coping some words and diagrams everybody was happy. Shame for him and his cheating students.
